subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|そら|yomi=kun}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=そら|-}}.  Found in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' c. 712 CE.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|から|yomi=kun}}

Cognate with {{ja-r|殻|から|[[shell]]}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|くう}}

# empty air
# [[meaninglessness]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=くう|Buddhism}} [[shunya]] ([[Śūnyatā]]): [[emptiness]], [[vacuity]], [[awareness]], [[openness]], [[thusness]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=くう|Buddhism}} {{w|Five elements (Japanese philosophy)#Void_(Aether)|void}}: one of the {{l|ja|五大}} (''godai''; lit. "''[[great]] [[five]]); also known as {{l|ja|天}} ({{l|ja|そら}}, sora''), of particular importance as the highest of the five elements

subSections.title: Etymology 5
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|うつお|hhira=うつほ}}

# {{alternative form of|うろ|lang=ja}}

subSections.title: Etymology 6
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|うつぼ|yomi=kun}}
Similar etymology to {{m|ja|空|tr=utsuo}}. As /h/ gradually changed from [p] → [ɸ] → [w] → [Ø], the phoneme was voiced to [b] in order to maintain it.
